title: Find Ratios of Consecutive Terms
text: To determine if a sequence is geometric, we find the ratio of the consecutive terms shown.

title: Ratio Between 27 and 9
text: What is the common ratio between 27 and 9? Effectively, what is $$\frac{9}{27}$$?

title: Ratio Between 9 and 3
text: What is the common ratio between 9 and 3? Effectively, what is $$\frac{3}{9}$$?

title: Ratio Between 3 and 1
text: What is the common ratio between 3 and 1? Effectively, what is $$\frac{1}{3}$$?

title: Ratio Between 1 and $$\frac{1}{3}$$
text: What is the common ratio between 1 and $$\frac{1}{3}$$? Effectively, what is $$\frac{\frac{1}{3}}{1}$$?

title: Ratio Between $$\frac{1}{3}$$ and $$\frac{1}{9}$$
text: What is the common ratio between $$\frac{1}{3}$$ and $$\frac{1}{9}$$? Effectively, what is $$\frac{\frac{1}{3}}{\frac{1}{9}}$$?

hintAnswer: Yes, the series is geometric. The common ratio is $$r=\frac{1}{3}$$.
title: Determining Commonality in Ratios
text: Are the ratios between consecutive terms common?
choices: Yes, the series is geometric. The common ratio is $$r=2$$.
Yes, the series is geometric. The common ratio is $$r=4$$.
Yes, the series is geometric. The common ratio is $$r=\frac{1}{3}$$.
No, the series is not geometric.
